{{cpp/regex/match_results/title|operator[]}}
{{cpp/regex/match_results/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++11|
const_reference operator[]( size_type n ) const;
}}

If {{c|n &gt; 0}} and {{c|n &lt; size()}}, returns a reference to the {{lc|std::sub_match}} representing the part of the target sequence that was matched by the {{c|n}}{{sup|th}} captured [[cpp/regex/ecmascript#Sub-expressions|marked subexpression]]).

If {{c|1=n == 0}}, returns a reference to the {{lc|std::sub_match}} representing the part of the target sequence matched by the entire matched regular expression.

if {{c|1=n &gt;= size()}}, returns a reference to a {{lc|std::sub_match}} representing an unmatched sub-expression (an empty subrange of the target sequence).

{{cpp/precondition|{{rlpf|ready}} must be {{c|true}}.}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|n|integral number specifying which match to return}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Reference to the {{lc|std::sub_match}} representing the specified matched subrange within the target sequence.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;regex&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    std::string target("baaaby");
    std::smatch sm;

    std::regex re1("a(a)*b");
    std::regex_search(target, sm, re1);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "entire match: " &lt;&lt; sm[0] &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "submatch #1: " &lt;&lt; sm[1] &lt;&lt; '\n';

    std::regex re2("a(a*)b");
    std::regex_search(target, sm, re2);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "entire match: " &lt;&lt; sm[0] &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "submatch #1: " &lt;&lt; sm[1] &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
entire match: aaab
submatch #1: a
entire match: aaab
submatch #1: aa
}}
